intro: Crassula schimperi var. transvalensis, commonly known as the Transvaal Crassula, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features compact, fleshy leaves that are typically blue-green in color, arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white during the warmer months. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. Its slow growth rate and ornamental appearance make it a popular choice for rock gardens and indoor cultivation.
